Another way to make the crab ball NOT fall apart.
B√öN RI√äU
VIETNAMESE CRAB & TOMATOES NOODLE
Recipe: 6-8 medium serving bowl.
‚Ä¢64 oz chicken broth
‚Ä¢96 oz water
(use the chicken broth container for measuring)
‚Ä¢1-14 oz can minced crabs or shrimp in spice (rieu cua) any brand
‚Ä¢1/4 cup dried shrimps (soak) from @khomarket
‚Ä¢1-1.5 lbs ground pork
‚Ä¢2 eggs ü•ö
‚Ä¢1/2 lbs minced shrimp
‚Ä¢1 cup cooked crab meat
‚Ä¢Fried tofu
(you can buy already fried or buy firm tofu. Cut into cube then deep fry until crispy)
‚Ä¢4-5 large tomatoes (cut into 4-6 pieces each)
‚Ä¢1 large onion (cut)
‚Ä¢1 tablespoon chopped garlic
‚Ä¢2 tablespoon cooking oil
‚Ä¢1 teaspoon annatto powder or seeds
‚Ä¢1.5 tablespoon salt
‚Ä¢1 oz rock sugar or 1 tablespoon sugar
‚Ä¢2 tablespoon chicken powder
‚Ä¢1 tablespoon fish sauce (3 crabs brand)
‚Ä¢1/2 teaspoon ground pepper
‚Ä¢1/4 cup ketchup (optional, to enhance the tomatoes flavor)
‚Ä¢green onion

1‚Ä¢In a bowl add ground pork, minced shrimp, crab in spices, egg and ground pepper. Add crabs meat at this time if prefer. My kids doesn‚Äôt eat crabs meat for this dish so I‚Äôm not adding it in. Mix well and store it in the refrigerator(30 minute) to firm up.
2‚Ä¢In a big pot add chicken broth, water, and dried shrimps. Bring to a full boil then low to simmer for 15 minutes.
3‚Ä¢In a pan add cooking oil and annatto seeds. Fry for 8-10 second or until seeds release all color. Remove seeds after done.
4‚Ä¢Add garlic and onion Saut√© for 10-15 second then add tomatoes and ketchup. Saut√© for 1-2 minutes. Shut off.
5‚Ä¢Add tofu, saut√© tomatoes, sugar, salt, chicken powder to the broth pot.
6‚Ä¢On medium boil. Add in your crab mixture with a spoon. Try to lay them on top of the tofu and tomatoes. Cover and let it simmer for 5-6 minutes. To firm up. This will help the meatballs from falling apart. Uncovered and use the spoon to push it slightly down
7‚Ä¢Continue with another batch of meatballs and repeat the step until all done. Do not stir the pot.
8‚Ä¢Add fish sauce, taste and adjust. Simmer on low for 5 minutes. Add onion and enjoy üòâ
Ps, when adding crabs ball it‚Äôs best not to have the heat too high. Simmering is what you want.
